required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Post Marketing Surveillance Study for ADYNOVATE in South Korea
clinical_study.official_title: A Post Marketing Surveillance Study for ADYNOVATE in South Korea

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to characterize the safety and describe hemostatic effectiveness in patients receiving ADYNOVATE in routine clinical practice.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the duration of patient participation of 6 months. Entire study period will be 72 months.
primary_outcome.description: Serious adverse events and non-serious adverse events

primary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the duration of patient participation of 6 months. Entire study period will be 72 months.
primary_outcome.description: Serious adverse events and non-serious adverse events

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of inhibitor titers for FVIII antibodies
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the duration of patient participation of 6 months. Entire study period will be 72 months.
secondary_outcome.description: By titer levels, high and lower titer categories

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the duration of patient participation of 6 months. Entire study period will be 72 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Number of treated bleeds throughout the study period

secondary_outcome.measure: ADYNOVATE units required for bleed resolution
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At bleed resolution, throughout the duration of patient participation of 6 months. Entire study period will be 72 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Number of ADYNOVATE units required for bleed resolution

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of ADYNOVATE infusions needed for the treatment of bleeding episodes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At bleed resolution, throughout the duration of patient participation of 6 months. Entire study period will be 72 months.
secondary_outcome.description: The number of ADYNOVATE infusions needed for each bleeding episode is determined by the participant, his/her caregiver, and/or clinician treating the participant, and is based upon the participant's response to treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Hemostatic effectiveness assessment of bleeding episodes treated with ADYNOVATE during prophylaxis treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the duration of patient participation of 6 months. Entire study period will be 72 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Using a 4-point ordinal scale (Excellent, Good, Fair, or None)

secondary_outcome.measure: Hemostatic effectiveness of ADYNOVATE for participants on an on-demand regimen
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At bleed resolution, throughout the duration of patient participation of 6 months. Entire study period will be 72 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Using a 4-point ordinal scale (Excellent, Good, Fair, or None)

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of perioperative effectiveness of ADYNOVATE
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the duration of patient participation of 6 months. Entire study period will be 72 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Using a 4-point ordinal scale (Excellent, Good, Fair, or None)

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinically significant changes in laboratory results
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the duration of patient participation of 6 months. Entire study period will be 72 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Number of clinically significant changes in laboratory results

arm_group.description: All participants enrolled will be treated with ADYNOVATE for hemophilia A at the time of enrollment according to a regimen determined by the study site treating physician/investigator.

study_pop.textblock: Hemophilia A patients in South Korea who have been prescribed ADYNOVATE.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria
Participants with a diagnosis of hemophilia A who have been prescribed ADYNOVATE according to the investigator's judgment shall be included in this study if:
- The participant or legally authorized representative has given written informed consent to participate in the study.
- The participant is indicated for treatment according to the ADYNOVATE South Korea prescribing information (PI).
Exclusion Criteria
Participants should be excluded from this study if:
- The participant or legally authorized representative does not wish to participate in the study.
- Any of the contraindications included in the PI for ADYNOVATE apply.
- Participant is enrolled in an interventional trial using an investigational product other than ADYNOVATE.

facility.name: Severance Hospital Yonsei University Health System
Kyung Hee University Hospital at Gangdong

patient_data.ipd_description: Shire provides access to the de-identified individual participant data for eligible studies to aid qualified researchers in addressing legitimate scientific objectives. These IPDs will be provided following approval of a data sharing request, and under the terms of a data sharing agreement.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: IPD from eligible studies will be shared with qualified researchers according to the criteria and process described in the Data Sharing section of the www.shiretrials.com website. For approved requests, the researchers will be provided access to anonymized data (to respect patient privacy in line with applicable laws and regulations) and with information necessary to address the research objectives under the terms of a data sharing agreement.
